components.description:
A banded stack of euro banknotes, the paper currency of the European Union (EU). Color and detail vary across platforms, but shown with the euro sign, €. Commonly used for various content concerning wealth and money, not restricted to the EU.

Some vendors, including Apple and Samsung, depict green €100 bills; others, including Google, WhatsApp, and Facebook, depict blue €20 bills. Facebook additionally features the EU flag.
components.title: Banknote with Euro Sign

Some vendors, including Apple and Samsung, depict green €100 bills; others, including Google, WhatsApp, and Facebook, depict blue €20 bills. Facebook additionally features the EU flag.
title: Banknote with Euro Sign

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Money symbols

bn:00102440a: Of or relating to or characteristic of Europe or the people of Europe

bn:00113489a: Having great material or monetary value especially for use or exchange

bn:00102576a: Being high in price, having high charges.
High in price or charging high prices

bn:00092745v: Save from ruin, destruction, or harm

bn:00083486v: To require payment (for goods, services, etc.) of.

bn:00087801v: Hand over one and receive another, approximately equivalent

bn:00008364n: A bank is a financial intermediary that accepts deposits and channels those deposits into lending activities, either directly by loaning or indirectly through capital markets.
Branch office of such an institution.
A financial institution where one can borrow money (upon which interest is due) or deposit money (in order to collect interest).
An institution where one can place and borrow money and take care of financial affairs.
A financial institution that accepts deposits and channels the money into lending activities
A business that keeps money for individual people or companies, exchanges currencies, makes loans, and offers other financial services.
The bank or financial institution that the payment format file is transmitted to for processing.

bn:00068918n: A contract of sale is a legal contract an exchange of goods, services or property to be exchanged from seller to buyer for an agreed upon value in money paid or the promise to pay same.
An agreement (or contract) in which property is transferred from the seller (vendor) to the buyer (vendee) for a fixed price in money (paid or agreed to be paid by the buyer)
An exchange of goods or services for currency or credit.

A contract that involves an exchange of goods, services or property to be exchanged from seller (or vendor) to buyer (or purchaser) for an agreed upon value in money (or money equivalent) paid or the promise to pay same.

A source document that documents an agreement between two or more parties based on an understanding that a selling party will commit to selling a specific quantity or value of product over a period of time in exchange for favorable prices and discounts.
Exchange of goods or services for currency or credit.
A contract with the target of the change in ownership (of goods, services, companies, etc)

bn:00031888n: The euro is the official currency of the eurozone, which consists of 18 of the 27 member states of the European Union: Austria, Belgium, Cyprus, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Luxembourg, Malta, the Netherlands, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, and Spain.
A currency used in a number of European Union countries.
The internationally accepted currency code that represents the Euro currency.
The currency of the European Monetary Union, with symbol "â‚¬".
The currency unit of the https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Monetary_Union European Monetary Union. Symbol: â‚¬
Currency unit of the European Monetary Union.

The euro is the currency used by the Institutions of the European Union and is the official currency of the eurozone, which consists of 18 of the 28 member states of the European Union: Austria, Belgium, Cyprus, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Luxembourg, Malta, the Netherlands, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, and Spain.

The basic monetary unit of most members of the European Union (introduced in 1999); in 2002 twelve European nations (Germany, France, Belgium, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Italy, Spain, Portugal, Ireland, Greece, Austria, Finland) adopted the euro as their basic unit of money and abandoned their traditional currencies

bn:00008375n: A piece of paper money (especially one issued by a central bank)
A fiat currency issued during the American Civil War
A piece of paper money; a banknote.
The term greenback refers to paper currency issued by the United States during the American Civil War.
A banknote is a type of negotiable instrument known as a promissory note, made by a bank, payable to the bearer on demand.
A unit of American currency issued during the Civil War by the Treasury Department.

bn:00024507n: The metal or paper medium of exchange that is presently used
A unit of exchange (such as money) used to facilitate transactions.
Money or other items used to facilitate transactions.
Money or other item used to facilitate transactions.
A currency in the most specific use of the word refers to money in any form when in actual use or circulation as a medium of exchange, especially circulating banknotes and coins.
Any form of money in public circulation that is not your base (local) currency.
Any form of money, including bills and coins, used as a medium of exchange.
A medium of exchange in circulation that is not limited to money.

An 8-byte, fixed-point data type that is useful for calculations involving money or for fixed-point calculations in which accuracy is extremely important. The Currency data type is used to store numbers with up to 15 digits to the left of the decimal point and 4 digits to the right. The type-declaration character in MicrosoftÂ© Visual BasicÂ© is an at sign (@). Currency can range from -922,337,203,685,477.5808 to 922,337,203,685,477.5807.
Currency is a physical medium of exchange, typically represented in modern times by government-printed paper notes and government-minted coins.
Monetized in specific units (euros, dollars, pesos, etc.) which may be given international value by their exchange values in foreign exchange

bn:00055644n: Means of exchange and measure of value.
A medium for exchanging ownership of the economic values represented by one or more currency units.
A generally accepted means of exchange and measure of value.
An unspecified amount in a currency.
Money is any item or verifiable record that is generally accepted as payment for goods and services and repayment of debts in a particular country or socio-economic context.

Money is commonly defined by the functions attached to any good or token that functions in trade as a medium of exchange, store of value, and unit of account, although economics offers various definitions.
Object or record accepted as payment
The most common medium of exchange; functions as legal tender

bn:01662203n: Banknote of the single European currency euro, which is in use in the 13 countries of the Eurozone.
The euro banknotes are the banknotes of the euro, the currency of the Eurozone.
